result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael W. Lehmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
W/Huber for all purposes
May serve in Lincoln County
Consecutive to: 08ct185

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael W. Lehmann

records.addlTxt:
1:03 p.m. Defendant Michael W. Lehmann in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett. Michael William Schiek, D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek speaks to agreement/counsel to argue sentence. State moves to amend Ct. 1 to 946.425(1m)(a), Class A msd. Court grants amendment. Defendant pleads no contest. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free & voluntary. Court finds factual basis for plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Bennett/Lehmann statement to sentencing. Court statement. 

Court sentence
10 days' county jail--consecutive to current sentence in 08CT185, with Huber - may serve in Lincoln Co. 
CC
DNA surcharge
Appeal rights

  Review hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

10:03 am - Defendant Michael W. Lehmann in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Michael W. Lehmann in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 08ct185 (MH) and 15cf32 (STC).  Bennett/Schiek statement to motion.  Court will not grant sentence modification/credit for treatment.  Court addresses release for Huber.  Jail is to determine release for Huber.  Court will uphold original sentence and will grant furlough until Monday, February 9, 2015 at 4 p.m.  No electronic monitoring to be allowed for serving sentence.  In 15cf32 - Need to schedule further proceedings, preliminary hearing.  Prelim set for 02-11-15 at 9 a.m. in 15cf32.  Bail continued in 15cf32.

02:49 pm - Defendant Michael W. Lehmann in court with attorney Brian Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -Time limits waived
Bail continued  Status conference scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 09:45 am.

01:37 pm - Defendant Michael W. Lehmann in court, via video, with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Defendant Michael W. Lehmann in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for Adjourned Initial as Drewa is not formally retained.  Schiek/Drewa to bond.  Court sets sig bond.  Defendant to commence 180 day sentence as of yesterday's date.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
